instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

threads.title: imac 27 mid 2011
threads.message: Hi, I have an imac 27 that has lines vertical blue, red, then try to start system but it gets white screen, I thought it was a video chip, I did reballing, but the same problem continued, so I changed the gpu chip 216-0811000 and the problem continued, I also tried external video, it stays on a blank screen, I also tried good ram memory, any suggestions you can make

threads.title: imac 27 mid 2011
threads.message:
First of all, welcome to the forum!

How the problem appeared?
Can you post some pictures?
You may have faulty VRAM...

threads.title: imac 27 mid 2011
threads.message:
How the problem appeared?
I don't have that information, I don't have customer contact
Can you post some pictures?
I have a video that I post to you
in such a case it is possible to diagnose a bad vram module, or is it changing each module and testing and which one fails?Is it best to change the scrap vram of video card o buy new?
[URL]https://www.youtube.com/shorts/CoW_wF8nA_M[/URL]

threads.title: imac 27 mid 2011
threads.message:
That link doesn't help.
You've posted a private video.

Testing with known good graphics card is the best option.

threads.title: imac 27 mid 2011
threads.message: ok, this is video [URL]https://youtube.com/shorts/CoW_wF8nA_M?feature=share[/URL], I don't have a video card to test in good condition :( , according to your experience, this damage is caused either by vram or gpu  chip usually

threads.title: imac 27 mid 2011
threads.message:
You've already change GPU and get the same problem.
Strange to get 2 faulty chips with exact same behavior, don't think?
Looks more like VRAM failure...

threads.title: imac 27 mid 2011
threads.message:
ok, ok change other card with vram in good condition and it worked, however do ASD shows hard drive fan error, is it necessary to change it? 
imac have original hard drive
[ATTACH type="full" alt="IMG_2683.jpg"]61062[/ATTACH]

threads.title: imac 27 mid 2011
threads.message:
Check HDD temperature sensor.
You've probably forgot to reconnect it.
